Bobby_Lewis_(country_singer):
{{short description|American country music singer-songwriter (born 1942)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2020}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Bobby Lewis | image = | caption = | image_size = | birth_name = | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1942|05|09}} | origin = [[Hodgenville, Kentucky]], United States{{cite book|title=[[Encyclopedia of Popular Music|The Guinness Encyclopedia of Popular Music]]|editor=[[Colin Larkin (writer)|Colin Larkin]]|publisher=[[Guinness Publishing]]|date=1992|edition=First|isbn=0-85112-939-0|page=1471}} | death_date = | instrument = Vocals, guitar, lute | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | occupation = Singer-songwriter | years_active = 1963–present | label = [[United Artists Records|United Artists]] | website = {{url|bobbylewislute.com/}} }} '''Bobby Lewis''' (born May 9, 1942) is an American [[country music]] singer-songwriter. Between 1963 and 1985, Lewis released ten albums and charted more than twenty-five songs on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Hot Country Songs|Hot Country Singles]] chart. His biggest hit, "How Long Has It Been", peaked at No. 6 in 1966. Lewis released a 26 country charted singles from 1966 to 1985.{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2017|publisher=Record Research, Inc|year=2017|pages=207–208|isbn=978-0-89820-229-8}} Lewis earned the title "The Boy with the Lute" for his usage of a six-string guitar-[[lute]], and was inducted to the Atlanta Country Music Hall of Fame on November 29, 2014.{{cite web|title=Bobby Lewis' induction to Atlanta Country Music Hall of Fame|url=http://garyhayescountry.com/country-legend-bobby-lewis-inducted-to-atlanta-country-music-hall-of-fame/|date=October 28, 2014|first=Gary|last=Hayes}} He became a member of the [[Grand Ole Opry]] and continues to perform and record new material. ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable" !
